item.title: How Ghost of Yotei's 1603 Setting Could Pave the Way for One Overarching Theme
item.description:
The reveal of Ghost of Yotei has been one of the biggest announcements of the year so far, with Sucker Punch taking its beloved Ghost of Tsushima franchise in an unexpected direction. Ghost of Yotei brings a fresh story to life with protagonist Atsu. Although much of the story still remains a secret, the first trailer for the game teases a ruthless journey filled with revenge-fueled bloodshed.

The mystery of Ghost of Yotei makes it a compelling game to speculate on, but one of the most intriguing differences from its predecessor is its significant time jump. Ghost of Yotei takes place in 1603, which is more than 300 years after the events of Ghost of Tsushima . This time jump is one of the biggest questions surrounding Ghost of Yotei and its story. Although many were surprised about the focus on a different time period, the year of 1603 marks a huge cultural change for Japan that could set the stage for one of Ghost of Yotei 's main themes.

Ghost of Yotei's Setting Marks the Beginning of Japan's Edo Period

A Time Defined By Rigid Social Standards

The Edo period lasted over 200 years, but it officially began in 1603, according to historians. This is one of the most significant times in Japan's long history, as it brought the country into a much stricter hierarchy that greatly valued an emphasis on social classes. Despite its mysterious nature, there is a lot to be analyzed from early looks at Ghost of Yotei . With this setting in particular, Atsu's journey technically takes place outside of Japan, so her journey and methods may clash with the changing world around her.

Mount Yotei and Hokkaido

As the title implies, Ghost of Yotei uses Mount Yotei as a backdrop for its setting. Located on the island of Hokkaido, this is an intriguing choice for a setting, as the island wasn't officially made part of Japan until 1869. This means that either Atsu could be running away to the area, or she could have been raised on the island. If the former is true, then it could be possible that Atsu is seeking solace in Hokkaido, as she is fleeing Japan's transformation into a stricter society. In the trailer, Atsu is portrayed as a renegade, and this directly clashes with both the samurai bushido code and the country of Japan as a whole.

The term "bushido" was first written down in 1616.

During the Edo period, a nomadic lifestyle was not in line with the samurai way, especially if it was fueled by bloodlust. By this time, the samurai were beginning to formalize bushido, giving samurai a far more rigid set of rules to follow in order to serve as an example to those who were considered to be in the lower classes. Atsu's embrace of a more free lifestyle in Ghost of Yotei could be the start of one of the game's main conflicts.

Atsu Paving Her Own Path in a Changing Social Order

Bushido Virtues That Helped Define the Edo Period

  • Righteousness
  • Courage
  • Benevolence
  • Respect
  • Honesty
  • Honor
  • Loyalty

On the surface, these seven virtues are great rules to live by, but taking them too close to the heart can create a suffocating environment. During this period, the samurai lifestyle seemed to have a far more black and white perspective on issues of the time, while Atsu could potentially see everything as far more gray. If Ghost of Yotei aims to bring the franchise into a new era, then shining a spotlight on this conflict in morality could be a fascinating starting point for the game's story.

Based on early looks, it seems like Ghost of Yotei will be a fascinating dive into a specific period of Japan's history. There is an important meaning behind this time jump, and the start of the Edo period could easily be the reason why.

item.title: Wayfinder - 1.0 Launch Trailer
item.description: Wayfinder has left early access and the 1.0 version is available on Steam and PlayStation 5 now. Check out the trailer for the co-op ARPG here.

item.title: Alan Wake 2 Gets Anniversary Update
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Alan Wake 2 will receive a free anniversary update on October 22.
  • The patch will feature many highly requested quality-of-life updates, including immortality and infinite ammo.
  • The game's second major DLC, The Lake House, will also be released on October 22.

Remedy Entertainment has announced that Alan Wake 2 will receive a free anniversary update on October 22 that is packed with features that have been requested by the game’s community. This free update comes as Alan Wake 2 is about to celebrate its first anniversary, with Remedy Entertainment continuing to improve players’ experience with the addition of new features and bug fixes.

Alan Wake 2 , the long-awaited sequel to the 2010 psychological horror title, was released in October 2023. The game follows two interconnected storylines involving best-selling novelist Alan Wake, who has been trapped in an alternate dimension for over a decade, and an FBI agent named Saga Anderson. Alan Wake 2 was met with enthusiasm from both players and critics, selling over 1.3 million units by February 2024 and being nominated for multiple Game of the Year awards. Following this success, developer Remedy Entertainment released the first DLC expansion for Alan Wake 2, Night Springs , expanding the story with three extra episodes. A second DLC, The Lake House , is set to release on October 22.

As Alan Wake 2 is about to celebrate its first anniversary, Remedy Entertainment announced the upcoming release of a free update that will add several new features and enhancements to Alan Wake 2 on its official website. Remedy Entertainment gathered feedback in order to release an update filled with the most highly anticipated quality-of-life improvements that all players will be able to download for free. Through the Gameplay Assist menu, players can now invert both the vertical and horizontal axis on mouse and controller, opt for accessibility options like infinite ammo or player immortality, choose to autocomplete QTE, or enable quick turn to face another direction faster. This free first-anniversary update for Alan Wake 2 will be available on October 22, the same day as The Lake House DLC.

Quality-of-Life Changes Coming in the Alan Wake 2 Free Anniversary Update

  • Quick turn ability
  • Autocomplete QTE
  • Button tapping to single tap
  • Weapon charging with taps
  • Healing items with taps
  • Lightshifter with taps
  • Player invulnerability
  • Player immortality
  • One shot kills
  • Infinite ammo
  • Infinite flashlight batteries

On top of these changes, PlayStation users can find a variety of improvements by utilizing the DualSense controller. The Alan Wake 2 anniversary update will bring gyro aiming support as well as haptic feedback for healing items and throwables, on top of the already existing haptic support for weapons. A variety of options for the DualSense will also be available through the game’s menu, such as the ability to turn the motion sensor function on and off, tweak horizontal and vertical sensitivity, set gyro space, and choose whether the pitch, yaw, and roll directions are standard or inverted.

Launching alongside the free update is The Lake House DLC for Alan Wake 2 , the game’s second major DLC expansion. The Lake House will take place alongside Alan Wake 2 ’s main story, with players taking control of FBC agent Kiran Estevez as she investigates the Lake House, a research facility filled with new enemies to face.

item.title: Fortnite's Disney Collab Needs to Finally Make Good on One Rumored Inclusion
item.description:
Fortnite has created a legacy built on massive crossovers and collaborations with some of the biggest franchises in pop culture. From its current Fortnitemares event showcasing Texas Chainsaw Massacre and Saw to having entire game modes, like LEGO Fortnite, focusing on a specific brand, the evolution of Fortnite is reaching even greater heights. Now that Disney is aiming to dive deeper into the world of Fortnite , many more collaborations are inevitable.

Fortnite and Disney have ambitious plans for the game, as the two are hoping to build an in-game Disney universe. Much of this remains a mystery, but after the company invested $1.5 billion in Epic Games at the beginning of the year, the partnership is clearly serious. Characters from The Incredibles to notable Disney villains have been slated for the game since then, but if Fortnite and Disney really want to spark a frenzy among players, then proving this year's Kingdom Hearts rumors to be true would be a huge moment for the battle royale.

Fortnite and Disney's Partnership Makes Kingdom Hearts Crossover Rumors Hold Serious Weight

A Long-Awaited Collaboration Has Yet to Happen

These rumors began back in May when leaker Midori stated that Kingdom Hearts would be branching out for crossovers with other games, specifically mentioning Fortnite . With Disney's large investment, many were quick to assume that this crossover would happen quickly. However, these claims came and went without any proof coming to light. More rumors entered the spotlight, though, when several notable leakers suggested that Fortnite and Disney would announce a Kingdom Hearts crossover at this year's D23 event. Since the event happened back in August, these leaks never came to fruition, but this doesn't mean that they were entirely untrue.

Leakers Are Potentially Onto Something

Despite both sets of leaks and rumors having yet to be confirmed, it is still completely possible that these individuals are on a trail that leads toward the eventual announcement of Kingdom Hearts coming to Fortnite . There have now been two instances of rumors revolving around Kingdom Hearts being added to the popular battle royale. The combination of reports suggesting that Kingdom Hearts is aiming for more crossovers and Fortnite getting close with Disney points to this collaboration as being inevitable.

In addition to upcoming Disney collaborations, Fortnite has already featured plenty of crossovers from the company, like Marvel Comics and Pirates of the Caribbean .

Now, the big question revolves around when an announcement will finally happen, if these leaks point to something accurate. The release of The Incredibles and Disney villains were scheduled relatively close together. With Disney's ambitious goals for Fortnite , it's not out of the realm of possibility for the game to add iconic characters from the company quite regularly. In fact, Disney has played a significant role in this year's Fortnitemares. The Nightmare Before Christmas has introduced some great skins as well.

Kingdom Hearts Needs to Come to Fortnite Sooner, Rather Than Later

Although the inclusion of major Disney characters has been exciting for some players, finally bringing Kingdom Hearts into the picture would be an exciting moment for longtime gamers. As a blend of Final Fantasy and major Disney franchises, Kingdom Hearts has grown into one of the 21-century's most beloved series of games. There are some downsides to Fortnite 's Disney crossover, but featuring Kingdom Hearts would be one of the game's biggest collaborations yet.

If this rumored crossover doesn't come to light soon, then there is still at least another perfect moment for Kingdom Hearts to come to Fortnite . With the wait for Kingdom Hearts 4 continuing, Disney and Fortnite could have the perfect marketing opportunity by releasing a crossover ahead of the game's release. Despite no official confirmation from Disney or Epic Games, it would be surprising if Kingdom Hearts never made its way into the world of Fortnite .

item.title: Call of Duty Gets Gigantic New Update
item.description:
Key Takeaways

  • Call of Duty introduces an update improving its UI and preparing for the Black Ops 6 launch.
  • The update's file size varies by platform.
  • Activision promises future updates will have smaller file sizes following the launch of Black Ops 6.

Call of Duty players are able to download a big new update that preloads Black Ops 6 and improves Call of Duty HQ's problematic UI. Black Ops 6 is the next entry in Activision's storied FPS franchise. Bringing the return of round-based Zombies, a single-player campaign set in the early 90s, and 16 original multiplayer maps, Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is one of the biggest releases of the Fall season and has fans eager to check out its enticing new omnimovement system that lets players sprint, slide, and dive in any direction.

Back in August, Activision proposed a roadmap of updates aiming to reduce Call of Duty 's exorbitant file sizes and address the Call of Duty HQ's heavily criticized UI. This effort began with Season 5's Reloaded update, which quietly laid the groundwork to reorganize the game's files. Black Ops 6 's open beta went live on August 30, with the user interface update planned for mid-October. The roadmap includes the launch of Black Ops 6 on the 25th, as well as Season 1, which is expected to begin in early December.

Now, Call of Duty has rolled out its promised UI update. While it doesn't bring any gameplay changes to Modern Warfare 3 or Warzone , the update isn't entirely empty calories, as it prepares the Call of Duty HQ for Black Ops 6 's imminent launch and introduces its new UI. On PlayStation 5 the update eats up 52 GB of storage space, while, puzzlingly, the same update weighs in at 112 GB on Xbox Series X and S. It's been reported that this difference in size is due to a bug on Xbox, and that the actual size of the update on Xbox is smaller.

New Call of Duty Update Prepares for Black Ops 6 Launch With New UI

While 52 GB is still considered by many to be way too bloated for an update, fans should expect these file sizes to become smaller over time. When Activision first laid out its roadmap in August, it expressed that some of these prep updates would be larger, but these will pave the way for Call of Duty update sizes to be smaller in the future. With that said, this pre- Black Ops 6 update should be one of the last updates that causes Call of Duty players to start sweating. Hopefully, the updated COD HQ UI is up to snuff for fans as well, as it's been the source of many headaches ever since it was introduced alongside Modern Warfare 2 two years ago.

Call of Duty: Black Ops 6 is getting ready for its release on October 25. Unlike in recent years, Call of Duty isn't offering early access to Black Ops 6 's campaign as it did with Modern Warfare 2 and last year's Modern Warfare 3 . That said, Black Ops 6 is set to launch directly onto Game Pass for Xbox gamers on day one, the first ever Call of Duty title to do so, following Xbox's buyout of Activision Blizzard.
